title: Research Experience
text:
Pharmacy Resident - Research Rotation

Sep 2017 - Nov 2018


University Health Network, Toronto, ON

Supervisor: Dr. Miranda So, PharmD, MPH (Epidemiology), BScPhm

Prepared research proposal for Reserach Ethics Board submission: “Antimicrobial Management and Outcomes of Cancer Patietns with Febrile Neutropenia Admitted to General Internal MEdicine at Toronto General Hospital”
Assessed electronic medical record data for patients to fit inclusion criteria
Collected and completed data analysis for 100 admitted patients
Submitted research manuscript for residency certification
Submitted research manuscript for publication to Antimicrobial Stewardship & Healthcare Epidemiology in 2023

title: Research Experience
text:
Advanced Pharmacy Practice Experience (APPE) Student

Jun - Aug 2016


Non-direct patient care rotation


St. Mary’s Hospital Lacor, Gulu, Uganda (10 weeks)

Supervisors: Dr. Doret Cheng, PharmD & Dr. Jacinta Apio, PharmD

Developed and performed a drug administration audit in various clinical units to identify gaps in patient care
Developed and performed a rational prescribing audit to aid the pharmacy department in the justification of ordering non-formulary items for the hospital

title: Research Experience
text:
Summer Pharmacy Research Student

May - Aug 2014


The Hospital for Sick Children, Toronto, ON

Supervisor: Dr. Winnie Seto, BScPhm, PharmD, MSc, ACPR, RPh (Primary Investigator)

Retrospectively collected and reviewed data on Once Daily Dosing (ODD) gentamicin and tobramycin in 200 critically ill pediatric patients
Prospectively collected, reviewed, and calculated pharmacokinetic parameters on ODD aminoglycosides in 30 hospital-wide pediatric patients
Reviewed Monte-Carlo simulations with pharmacokinetic data

title: Professional Experience
text:
Reviewed, and verified physician orders for safety and optimization of therapy In various clinical areas including the emergency department (ED), intensive care units (ICUs), and Seidman Cancer Center
Monitor and appropriately dose vancomycin in patients with an appropriate indication
Prepared and checked emergent medications using sterile compounding as per the USP 797 guidelines in the ED

title: Professional Experience

title: Professional Experience
text:
Clinical Pharmacist

Sep 2018 - Jan 2024


Michael Garron Hospital, Toronto, ON

Reviewed, and verified physician orders for safety and optimization of therapy in dispensary
Identified and resolved drug therapy problems, providing therapeutic recommendations to various clinical units including: ICU, General Internal Medicine (GIM), Emergency, Cardiology, Surgery, Maternal Health & Paediatrics and Antimicrobial Stewardship Program (ASP)
Evaluated appropriate antimicrobial use through ASP on ICU and ward patients via thrice weekly to daily rounding between Infectious Diseases and main responsible physician
Developed an ICU Pharmacists Handbook in response to COVID-19 to facilitate onboarding clinical pharmacists to critical care clinical practice
Developed a standardized Medication Reconciliation documentation for admitted patients
Conducted therapeutic discussions with pharmacy students weekly
Precepted Advanced Pharmacy Practice Experience (APPE) pharmacy student and Early Practice Experience (EPE)-2 pharmacy student on GIM, ICU and Antimicrobial Stewardship

title: Professional Experience
text:
Pharmacy Resident

Sep 2017 - Aug 2018


University Health Network, Toronto, ON

Provided patient-centered pharmacotherapy care in an interprofessional healthcare team on: GIM, Multi-Organ Transplant (MOT), Malignant Hematology, Medical-Surgical ICU, Ambulatory Hemodialysis, and Orthopedic Surgery
Clinical Instructor: Precepted EPE-2 pharmacy undergraduate student on MOT, facilitated small group seminars on Asthma/COPD and Gout for first year pharmacy students
Presentations to clinical pharmacists:

Direct Oral Anticoagulants in Solid Organ Transplant
Persistence for Resistance - a VAP with an ESBL
Alternative Vancomycin Regimens for Recurrent Clostridium Difficile Infection

title: Rachel Liu
text:
LinkedIn
  
  
    
     Email
  




Rachel Liu
I am a clinical pharmacist currently working at University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Centre. My clinical interests and experience includes the ICU, Emergency Medicine and Surgery. I am currently pursuing a Masters of Science in Pathology though am also eager to expand her research skills by completing a PhD in Systems Biology and Bioinformatics with a focus on the gut microbiome and cancer under the supervision of Dr. Douglas Brubaker at Case Western Reserve University.


Education
Doctor of Pharmacy, University of Toronto Leslie Dan Faculty of Pharmacy, Toronto, Canada | 2017
Accredited Canadian Pharmacy Residency (ACPR), University Health Network affiliated with University of Toronto, Toronto, ON | 2018


Professional Position
Clinical pharmacist | Jan 2024 - present, University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center, Department of Pharmacy, Cleveland, OH
